text: is called Bingbing by everyone who knows
him he's become a very charming and very
inquisitive and outgoing boy of course
when he was first attacked he didn't
quite grasp that his condition might be
permanent he thought that he might be
able to regain his sight but now he
understands that his condition is very
likely to remain permanent for the rest
of his life and he is adjusting
accordingly he's become very sensitive
to people's voices because that's of
course how he tells people apart and
when he greets people he touches them he
especially likes to touch their hair now
he spent a lot of time making origami
because again that helps his sense of
touch and his parents believe that
that's going to help him in the future
because he is not able to see his
parents are staying with him in in a
private hospital in Shenzhen the city
just across the border from from Hong
Kong and his mother specifically she's
trying to keep up a brave face but she
deals with an awful lot of guilt and
this is what she told me earlier today
we were so shocked by how quickly
everything happened he used to be normal
now he looks like this it's
heartbreaking
if on that day I had looked for him and
found him earlier then maybe all this
wouldn't have happened and Julian just
tell us I mean you spent some time with
girls mother you said that you know she
was anxious when you spoke to her about
the success of the operation do the
family still have hope though that one
day their son might be able to regain
some kind of vision well they certainly
do have hope and as she told me as as a
mother you always want the best for your
children and you're willing to do
anything to try to make sure that he has
some hope in future of being able to
regain some sight now Dennis LAN the
Hong Kong doctor who owns the hospital
and provided his services for free
certainly hopes that there is
cutting-edge technology that will mature

distinguish shapes or light
in future so there's some technology
